data: Physician must assess for patient’s potential of high risk extubation before considering eligibility for extubation

If any of the following risk factors are present, consider High Risk Extubation (Module)
- Previous difficult intubation
- History of airway abnormalities (i.e. airway trauma, burns, edema) 
- Restricted airway access (i.e. wired jaw, fused cervical spine) 
- Obesity (Body Mass Index greater than 30)
- Obstructive sleep apnea 
- Clinical features to suggest difficult intubation (see Airway Assessment Form)
- Other risk factors (fluctuating level of consciousness, poor cough or gag, difficulty clearing secretions)
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater
Extubate when patient is ready. Refer to ICU Weaning Pathway Guidelines
Select ‘Perform Swallowing Screen’ order for low risk extubations (for patients intubated less than 48 hours)
